bugs.title: CVE-2024-21535 jupyterlab: Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in markdown-to-jsx [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-21535 jupyterlab: Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in markdown-to-jsx [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-21535 markdown-to-jsx: Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in markdown-to-jsx

long_desc.thetext: Versions of the package markdown-to-jsx before 7.4.0 are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via the src property due to improper input sanitization. An attacker can execute arbitrary code by injecting a malicious iframe element in the markdown.
Reported upstream for jupyterlab: https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab/issues/16864
Fixed upstream in https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab/commit/e707512050c9b54e4a7a76c313f64cf0a9c4abc2 I'm waiting for the next release.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318700

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-44270 jupyterlab: Improper input validation in PostCSS [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-44270 jupyterlab: Improper input validation in PostCSS [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-44270 PostCSS: Improper input validation in PostCSS

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in PostCSS before 8.4.31. The vulnerability affects linters using PostCSS to parse external untrusted CSS. An attacker can prepare CSS in such a way that it will contains parts parsed by PostCSS as a CSS comment. After processing by PostCSS, it will be included in the PostCSS output in CSS nodes (rules, properties) despite being included in a comment.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.17

Via RHSA-2024:10517 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:10517

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2326998

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
